title: President/CEO
description: As President/CEO responsible for new business opportunity management, strategic business development and operational excellence. - Consultant to Pro2Serve - providing Subject Matter Expertise (SME) consulting in the Cybersecurity Market for new business development opportunity management including - Opportunity Analysis, Customer Engagement, Customer Strategic Framework & Direction, Offering Differentiators, Win Strategy development, Proposal Writing, and Contract Award Startup. - Consultant to Alion Science and Technology - Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) to PEO IWS 3.0 Major Program Manager (MPM) providing program management, technical and acquisition management support for new programs and mission areas within Navy critical ACAT weapons systems development. - Consultant to Paradigm Technologies - Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) to PEO IWS 3.0 Major Program Manager (MPM) providing program management, technical and acquisition management support for new programs and mission areas within Navy critical ACAT weapons systems development. - Consultant to Davidson Technologies providing Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in future Advanced Capability Builds (ACB) for Aegis Combat System/Weapon System; Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD); and DoD Information Assurance (IA), DIACAP and Platform Information Technology (PIT)/PIT Risk Assessment (PRA) for weapon systems development. - Consultant to K2Share, LLC - led development of Federal and DoD IA and Cyber Security future DHS new business pipeline development. Delivered New Business Opportunity Management Development Strategy and Process Guide, and Indefinite Delivery Contract Process Guide. Developed a Cyber Security Career & Professional Development Path and Hiring Model to “Recruit, Train & Retain” an innovative 21st Century Cyber Security workforce

title: CDR, Surface Warfare Officer
description: 24 Year Naval career including 4 years Enlisted/20 years as Surface Warfare Officer. My career included increasing levels of responsibility from Division Officer with 30 direct reports with O&M responsibility, to department head with responsibilities for training and ship/battle group readiness, combat operations, and material readiness and Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) of major combat systems and leadership of 10 division officers/chief petty officers @ 50 Sailors and financial O&M. Executive Officer/Chief Information Officer (CIO) of major Surface Combatant with responsibilities for organization administration - personnel, career and professional development, performance appraisal, financial operations, organization training, combat readiness and operations with 5 Department Head direct reports and a crew up to 325 Officers and Sailors. Operational tours - USS INDEPENDENCE (CV 62). Communications Officer/COMSEC Custodian and Damage Control Assistant USS HEPBURN (FF 1055). Fire Control Officer USS LAKE CHAMPLAIN (CG 57). Weapons Officer and Combat Systems Officer, Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) in USS CAPE ST GEORGE (CG 71). Executive Officer/Chief Information Officer (CIO) in USS JOHN S MCCAIN (DDG 56). Deployed to ground combat operations in IFREE and served in MNF-I/MNC-I in support of Counter IED Operations. Ashore Tours - Naval Post Graduate School in Monterrey, CA earned a Master’s in Information Technology Management (ITM). OPNAV Staff as Requirements Officer for the Director Warfare Requirements (N6/N7) and Programs and Plank Owner for Assistant Chief of Naval Operations (ACNO) for Missile Defense. OPNAV Staff as Section Head Force Air Defense for Director Warfare Requirements and Programs (N6/N7). Aegis Ballistic Missile Defense Program Office as Deputy Program Manager for International Programs and Deputy PM for the Sea-Based Terminal.

company: Navy, Director for Surface Warfare, CNO Staff
description: Section Head responsible for programming, planning, and budgeting for Naval Surface Warfare Force Air Defense Major Weapons Programs in support of President Budget submission to Congress. Budget accounts included Research & Development, Navy, Weapons Procurement, Navy and Operations & Maintenance, Navy. Responsible for developing requirements for new Major Weapons Programs through approval by Joint Requirements Oversight Counsel (JROC), Executive Acquisition Agent and Milestone Decision Authority. * Programmed, planned and budgeted $1.5B in Research and Development and Procurement for transformational major weapon programs in Joint Theater Air and Missile Defense * Led a Joint Service Integrated Product Team to develop Next-Generation Extended Range Active Surface-to-Air Missile and Joint Integrated Fire Control requirements and budget resources which lead to a Joint Requirements Oversight Council and Acquisition Executive Milestone B approval for System Demonstration and Development in less than 12 months * Developed strategic analysis of Navy investment in advanced technologies for counter low-observable/low-observable, integrated fire control and active missile technologies impacting Navy’s budget decisions and programs for Transformational Theater Air and Missile Defense * Developed a multi-million dollar cost-avoidance program for surface-to-air missile firings

title: Sr Systems Engineer / Intelligence Analyst
description: TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT Conducted Continental United States (CONUS) and outside Continental United States (OCONUS) training and curriculum development for Special Access Government Programs as well as established and executed training and exploitation scenario for several other Special Access Programs (SAPs). Assumed full accountability in serving as liaison between the Government Intelligence Agency and military personnel; performing currier duties; and serving as official representative for the Government Agency, government contractor, and department in CONUS and OCONUS conferences. Progressively led and conducted specific training programs to render assistance to workers in cultivating and improving job skills. Evaluated training needs through extensive surveys, interviews with employees and focus groups, as well as consultation with managers, instructors, and customer representatives. Handled the preparation and creation of training procedure manuals and guides and course materials, such as handouts and visual materials. Master-planned, designed, and oversaw orientation and training for employees and customers in industrial and commercial settings. RESEARCH AND INTELLIGENCE ANALYSIS Extensive analysis of high interest telemetry internals and externals Intelligence collection and asset management initiatives Geolocation of high-interest emitters Role as primary trainer for Special Access Programs Examination of target identification and operational pattern establishment Expertly performed advanced analysis techniques, signals intelligence (SIGINT) collection and analysis, space sensor systems implementation, and tool development company wide. Supervised and accomplished all aspects of instrumentation exploitation, namely detection, acquisition, location, identification, technical reporting, signal database maintenance, target development, and testing and evaluation.

title: 98J ELECTRONIC INTELLIGENCE INTERCEPTOR/ANALYST
description: Major duties. The electronics intelligence (ELINT) interceptor/analyst performs and supervises detection, acquisition, location, identification, exploitation, and reporting of foreign ELINT at all echelons. Performs collection management. (1) Deploys, installs, and operates ELINT collection systems. Searches for selected categories or classes of electro-optic or foreign instrumentation signals (FIS). Operates communications equipment for SIGINT reporting and coordination. Uses technical references and equipment to record and analyze intercepted signals. Uses specialized database and technical references to identify intercepted signals. Reports electronic order of battle (EOB) information and maintains a technical database. (2) Supervises electronic intelligence collection teams and searches for general categories or classes of electronic intelligence or electro-optic signals and operates all intercept, recording, and analysis equipment in a fixed or tactical operation. Uses database and technical references to identify intercepted signals. Recommends employment of units and establishes operations sites. Assists in fusion product reporting. Prepares and maintains enemy order of battle information. (3) Performs duties shown in preceding skill level and provides guidance to subordinate soldiers. Supervises squad level intercept and analysis of ELINT signals. Interprets and analyzes technical documents and reports. Assigns missions and inter cepts complex signals. Implements SIGINT/EW emergency action plans. Interprets and implements ELINT collection tasking. Identifies and allocates resources to accomplish the collection effort, Coordinates collection activities with other intelligence disciplines. Determines mission objectives and priorities.Coordinates tactical and strategic ELINT and provides appraisals of intelligence products, activities and operations. Develops unit intelligence training strategy.

description: ● Deployed in support of OIF to Multi-National Division-Baghdad (MND-B) and Multi-National Division-Central (MND-C) (11/07-11/08) Target Audience Analysis Team leader for intelligence analysts and psychological operations (PSYOP) specialists responsible for conducting target audience analysis. ● Analyzed finished intelligence products to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of PSYOP themes and messages to counter enemy propaganda and TTP. ● Tested PSYOP products using rapport building and tactical questioning techniques. ● Conduct hundreds of mounted and dismounted patrols with the MND-B and MND-C conducting PSYOP activities and passive intelligence collections while interacting with the local population as a tactical PSYOP team leader. ● Combined HUMINT collection and PSYOP techniques to create a unique capability routinely leveraged by ground commanders in the field. Regularly briefed senior officers (O-5 and above) on the human terrain and influence campaign.

title: Analyst
description: ● Produced all-source intelligence products to identify potential tactical and strategic target audiences for non-kinetic and covert actions and influence activities as part of the USF-I Information Operations and Psychological Operations Task Force-Iraq. Focus of effort was to balance Iranian influence throughout Iraq. ● Developed Information Operations targeting packets to provide USF-I IO courses of action. ● Conducted focus group analysis to assess potential target audiences and determine measures of effectiveness of IO implementation. ● Maintained separate foreign and Iraqi media databases and provided assessments to advise Chief of Information Operations (J39) of avenues of influence.

title: Intelligence Analyst
description: ● Produced all-source intelligence products focusing on cyber threats and trends targeting USG computer network systems and personnel for Department of State Regional Security Offices, Bureau of Diplomatic Security. ● Area of responsibility included the Western Hemisphere and Africa. ● Produced open-source intelligence products focusing on threats to mass transportation physical security and provided threat mitigation courses of action as part of the Surface Transportation/Public Transportation Information Sharing and Analysis Center located in Herndon, Virginia. ● Developed scenario-based readiness exercises for local, state, and federal responders in accordance with the Federal Emergency Management Agency standards.
